metadata.title: CVE-2020-12135 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
bson before 0.8 incorrectly uses int rather than size_t for many variables,parameters, and return values. In particular, the bson_ensure_space()parameter bytesNeeded could have an integer overflow via properlyconstructed bson input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwhoopsie0 - 0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5
whoopsie - 0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: duo-unix package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
whoopsie package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.52.5ubuntu0.5').
